definition: to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities

sentences.english: Holidays fried fruit, but also with butter.
sentences.chinese: 逢年過節炸果子，也用酥油。

sentences.english: In Vietnam, consumers are rethinking what to buy for the holiday known locally as Tet.
sentences.chinese: 在越南，消費者們正在重新思考該買些什麼過節。

sentences.english: All the people who flying over other cities will go home to celebrate with their families.
sentences.chinese: 所有流落異鄉的人都會回家過節。

sentences.english: At that time, most afraid of the Chinese Lunar New Year, a deserted home straight people cry.
sentences.chinese: 當時，最害怕過年過節，家裏面冷清得讓人直想哭。

sentences.english: Galinis plans a similar holiday using whatever she can find.
sentences.chinese: 和她類似，蓋麗絲打算用她能找到的食物過節。

sentences.english: It is a hallmark in Chinese festival celebration to get boozed up.
sentences.chinese: 過節狂飲是中國傳統的風俗之一。

sentences.english: Yeah, it's really festive around the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 過節的時候這裏總是很喜慶。

sentences.english: Tomorow is Lation Festval, I'll go back home and stay with my family then.
sentences.chinese: 明天是元宵節，我會回家同家人過節。

sentences.english: In my hometown in Hubei Province, the holidays have a custom to eat rice cakes.
sentences.chinese: 在我的家鄉湖北，過節有喫年糕的習俗。

sentences.english: Far from being sinister, his mask is a jokey icon of festive citizenship.
sentences.chinese: 面具無關險惡，只是公民過節的歡樂圖標。

sentences.english: Spend the holiday with your family or with your lover?
sentences.chinese: 是和家人一起過節，還是陪自己的另一半？

sentences.english: In September 10th, Chen Jing returned to Longchang County in Sichuan Province home holiday.
sentences.chinese: 9月10日，陳鏡回到四川省隆昌縣的老家中過節。

sentences.english: For example, the pull-off section could be used as a collectable token for promotions and competitions.
sentences.chinese: 例如，拉過節可以用作收藏品促銷和比賽令牌。

sentences.english: Shadow theatre became quite popular as early as the Song Dynasty when holidays were marked by the presentation of many shadow plays.
sentences.chinese: 皮影戲在宋代很盛行，逢年過節皮影戲的演出很多。

sentences.english: You received little red envelopes containing money on special occasions.
sentences.chinese: 在逢年過節時你總能收到紅包。

sentences.english: Holiday rituals give children points in the year to look forward to.
sentences.chinese: 過節的習慣使孩子們在一年裏都有了盼頭。

definition: to celebrate the Chinese New Year
Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
the Mid-Autumn Festival on 15th of 8th lunar month
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
